channel.title: DNS and Dynamic IP Addresses
channel.description: Hey I am running Apache and if I type in localhost or 127.0.0.1 in my address bar, I get the default Apache installation page, saying that it was completed successfully. Would I be able to see this page if I typed my dynamic ip address into my address bar? It doesn't let me. How can I fix this? I'm setting up dynamic dns with my domain name, and I'm having some problems, please help. :P Thanks! :D

item.title: DNS and Dynamic IP Addresses
item.dc:creator: @parad0x parad0x_
item.description:
@parad0x wrote:

Thanks, that helped a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: DNS and Dynamic IP Addresses
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

The primary reason you wouldn’t be able to access the server from your WAN ip is that your router or firewall is blocking access to it. Check out portforward.com for info on how to configure your router.

Read full topic

item.title: DNS and Dynamic IP Addresses
item.dc:creator: @parad0x parad0x_
item.description:
@parad0x wrote:

Hey I am running Apache and if I type in localhost or 127.0.0.1 in my address bar, I get the default Apache installation page, saying that it was completed successfully.
Would I be able to see this page if I typed my dynamic ip address into my address bar?
It doesn’t let me.
How can I fix this?
I’m setting up dynamic dns with my domain name, and I’m having some problems, please help.
Thanks!

Read full topic
